Aniruddha Guha of ''[[Daily News and Analysis]]'' said that Padukone "delivers the best of her four performances so far" and [[Nikhat Kazmi]] of ''The Times of India'' mentioned her as "definitive and strong."{{cite news |last=Guha |first=Aniruddha |title=Review: Love Aaj Kal is the perfect date movie |url=http://www.dnaindia.com/entertainment/review-review-love-aaj-kal-is-the-perfect-date-movie-1278796 |work=Daily News and Analysis |date=31 July 2009 |accessdate=16 July 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140106100802/http://www.dnaindia.com/entertainment/review-review-love-aaj-kal-is-the-perfect-date-movie-1278796 |archivedate=6 January 2014 |df=}}{{cite news |last=Kazmi |first=Nikhat |title=Love Aaj Kal |url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/movie-reviews/hindi/Love-Aaj-Kal/movie-review/4838891.cms |work=The Times of India |date=30 July 2009 |accessdate=16 July 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140127030129/http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/movie-reviews/hindi/Love-Aaj-Kal/movie-review/4838891.cms |archivedate=27 January 2014 |df=}} At the [[55th Filmfare Awards]] Padukone received a nomination for Best Actress.{{cite web |url=http://www.bollywoodhungama.com/movies/features/type/view/id/725/ |title=Nominations for 55th Idea Filmfare Awards 2009 |publisher=Bollywood Hungama |accessdate=27 April 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141020180943/http://www.bollywoodhungama.com/movies/features/type/view/id/725/ |archivedate=20 October 2014 |df=}} ===Career struggles (2010–2011)=== Padukone had five film releases in 2010. Her first role was in Vijay Lalwani's [[psychological thriller]] ''[[Karthik Calling Karthik]]'', where Padukone was cast as the supportive girlfriend of a depressed man (played by [[Farhan Akhtar]]) who goes through a series of changes after receiving mysterious phone calls every morning. Derek Elley of ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'' found the film to be "thinly plotted" but added that "the uncomplicated ingenuousness of Padukone ... helps make the tall tale convincing."{{cite news |last=Elley |first=Derek |title=Review: "Karthik Calling Karthik" |url=https://variety.com/2010/film/reviews/karthik-calling-karthik-1117942367/ |work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |date=8 March 2010 |accessdate=16 July 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130605055907/http://variety.com/2010/film/reviews/karthik-calling-karthik-1117942367/ |archivedate=5 June 2013 |df=}} Commercially, the film performed poorly.{{cite web |url=http://www.boxofficeindia.com/showProd.php?itemCat=318&catName=MjAxMA== |title=Box Office 2010 |publisher=Box office India |accessdate=14 May 2012 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131014062657/http://www.boxofficeindia.com/showProd.php?itemCat=318&catName=MjAxMA%3D%3D |archivedate=14 October 2013 |deadurl=yes |df=}} Her most economically profitable film that year was [[Sajid Khan]]'s {{INRConvert|1.15|b}}-grossing comedy film ''[[Housefull (2010 film)|Housefull]]'' in which she featured alongside an [[ensemble cast]] including Akshay Kumar, [[Ritesh Deshmukh]], [[Lara Dutta]], [[Arjun Rampal]], [[Jiah Khan]], and [[Boman Irani]]. [[Raja Sen]] described the film as a "festival of bad acting" and attributed Padukone's poor performance to her "plasticky expressions."{{cite web |last=Sen |first=Raja |title=Gags that'll make you gag |url=http://www.rediff.com/movies/review/review-housefull-is-painful/20100430.htm |publisher=Rediff.com |date=30 April 2010 |accessdate=14 September 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131012003148/http://www.rediff.com/movies/review/review-housefull-is-painful/20100430.htm |archivedate=12 October 2013 |df=}} [[File:Deepika Padukone at an event.jpg|thumb|upright=0.9|alt=Deepika Padukone is sitting on a chair and smiling at the camera|Padukone at a promotional event for ''[[Lafangey Parindey]]'' in 2010]] [[Pradeep Sarkar]]'s drama ''[[Lafangey Parindey]]'' (2010) saw Padukone star opposite [[Neil Nitin Mukesh]] in the role of Pinky Palkar, a blind girl determined to win a skating competition. In preparation for her role, she observed the interactions of blind people and rehearsed scenes while blindfolded.{{cite news |title=To play a blind dancer was very challenging: Deepika Padukone |url=http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/to-play-a-blind-dancer-was-very-challenging-deepika-padukone/1/106251.html |accessdate=3 September 2013 |work=India Today |date=22 July 2010 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6JwC8bHIt?url=http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/to-play-a-blind-dancer-was-very-challenging-deepika-padukone/1/106251.html |archivedate=27 September 2013 |deadurl=yes}} Writing for ''[[The Hindu]]'', Sudhish Kamath was particularly impressed by Padukone and wrote that she "exercises considerable restraint" in playing her part.{{cite news |url=http://www.thehindu.com/features/cinema/article600437.ece |title=Lafangey Parindey Movie Review |author=Kamath, Sudhish |work=The Hindu |accessdate=28 April 2011 |date=28 August 2010 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131220131856/http://www.thehindu.com/features/cinema/article600437.ece |archivedate=20 December 2013 |df=}} Later that year, ''[[Hindustan Times]]'' published that the film helped change people's perception of Padukone, with focus directed on her acting prowess rather than her appearance.{{cite news |last=Amrah |first=Ashraf |title=Deepika gets rave reviews for ''Lafangey Parindey'' |url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/bollywood/deepika-gets-rave-reviews-for-lafangey-parindey/story-YHPqXxE8L4QYytoxMsNnmI.html |work=Hindustan Times |date=21 August 2010 |accessdate=10 August 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304082556/http://www.hindustantimes.com/bollywood/deepika-gets-rave-reviews-for-lafangey-parindey/story-YHPqXxE8L4QYytoxMsNnmI.html |archivedate=4 March 2016 |df=}} Her next role was opposite [[Imran Khan (Bollywood actor)|Imran Khan]] in the [[Danish Aslam]]-directed romantic comedy ''[[Break Ke Baad]]''. [[CNN-IBN]]'s [[Rajeev Masand]] found the film to be "reasonably engaging" and noted that it was "watchable largely for the performance of its leading lady."{{cite web |last=Masand |first=Rajeev |title=Masand: Break Ke Baad is an engaging film |url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/masand-break-ke-baad-is-an-engaging-film/135956-8-66.html |publisher=[[CNN-IBN]] |date=16 December 2010 |accessdate=8 September 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131009233651/http://ibnlive.in.com/news/masand-break-ke-baad-is-an-engaging-film/135956-8-66.html |archivedate=9 October 2013 |df=}} Both ''Lafangey Parindey'' and ''Break Ke Baad'' underperformed at the box office. Padukone's final release of 2010 was [[Ashutosh Gowarikar]]'s [[Historical drama film|period film]] ''[[Khelein Hum Jee Jaan Sey]]'' opposite [[Abhishek Bachchan]]. Based on the book ''[[Do and Die]]'' by Manini Chatterjee, the film is a retelling of the 1930 [[Chittagong armoury raid]].{{cite web |url=http://www.rediff.com/movies/report/first-look-deepika-in-khelein-hum-jee-jaan-sey/20100519.htm |title=First look: Deepika in ''Khelein Hum Jee Jaan Sey'' |publisher=Rediff.com |accessdate=27 April 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131012033209/http://www.rediff.com/movies/report/first-look-deepika-in-khelein-hum-jee-jaan-sey/20100519.htm |archivedate=12 October 2013 |df=}} Bachchan featured as the revolutionary leader [[Surya Sen]] and Padukone played [[Kalpana Dutta]], his confidante.{{cite news |last=Mukherjee |first=Roshni |url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2010-12-02/news-interviews/28264661_1_period-thriller-deepika-padukone-kalpana-dutta |title=Working with Ashu sir is an achievement: Deepika |work=The Times of India |date=2 December 2010 |accessdate=10 October 2013}} Padukone said that she did not research for the role as there were "hardly ... any reference points as to what Kalpana looked like other than a few photos," and relied completely on Gowarikar's direction.{{cite web |title=`Khelein Hum` no less glamorous than any of my films: Deepika |url=http://zeenews.india.com/entertainment/bollywood/khelein-hum-no-less-glamorous-than-any-of-my-films-deepika_76567.html |publisher=Zee News |date=29 November 2010 |accessdate=4 April 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131003203240/http://zeenews.india.com/entertainment/bollywood/khelein-hum-no-less-glamorous-than-any-of-my-films-deepika_76567.html |archivedate=3 October 2013 |df=}} A review published in ''[[The Telegraph (UK)|The Telegraph]]'' was appreciative of Padukone's portrayal, and the film received a generally positive critical reception.{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/film/bollywood/8184397/Khelein-Hum-Jee-Jaan-Sey-review.html |title=Khelein Hum Jee Jaan Sey review |work=[[The Daily Telegraph]] |date=7 December 2010 |accessdate=28 April 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110315092308/http://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/film/bollywood/8184397/Khelein-Hum-Jee-Jaan-Sey-review.html |archivedate=15 March 2011 |df=}}{{cite news |last=Sahni |first=Diksha |title=Review Round-up: ‘Khelein Hum Jee Jaan Sey’ Is Well Played |url=https://blogs.wsj.com/indiarealtime/2010/12/03/review-round-up-%E2%80%98khelein-hum-jee-jaan-sey%E2%80%99-is-well-played/ |accessdate=26 October 2013 |newspaper=[[The Wall Street Journal]] |date=3 December 2010 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131029193900/https://blogs.wsj.com/indiarealtime/2010/12/03/review-round-up-%E2%80%98khelein-hum-jee-jaan-sey%E2%80%99-is-well-played/ |archivedate=29 October 2013 |df=}} Despite this, it was a major commercial disappointment.{{cite web |title=Bad times continue at the box office |url=http://www.rediff.com/movies/report/bad-times-continue-at-the-box-office/20101213.htm |publisher=Rediff.com |accessdate=4 April 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121025121346/http://www.rediff.com/movies/report/bad-times-continue-at-the-box-office/20101213.htm |archivedate=25 October 2012 |df=}} Padukone began 2011 with an item number in [[Rohan Sippy]]'s ''[[Dum Maaro Dum (film)|Dum Maaro Dum]]''. The song was a remixed version of the iconic song "[[Dum Maro Dum (song)|Dum Maro Dum]]," from the 1971 film ''[[Hare Rama Hare Krishna (1971 film)|Hare Rama Hare Krishna]]'', which featured [[Zeenat Aman]].{{cite news |url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2011-02-04/news-interviews/28359126_1_deepika-padukone-lyrics-rohan-sippy |title=Deepika's Dum Maro Dum with a twist |work=The Times of India |accessdate=27 April 2011 |date=4 February 2011}} Padukone referred to it as "the wildest song any actress has done;" the song's "suggestive lyrics" and "raunchy moves" attracted controversy including a court case for indecency.{{cite news |last=Sahgal |first=Geety |url=http://archive.indianexpress.com/news/its-the-wildest-song-any-actress-has-done-deepika/777015/ |title=It's the wildest song any actress has done: Deepika |newspaper=[[The Indian Express]] |accessdate=27 April 2011 |date=16 April 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151222155407/http://archive.indianexpress.com/news/its-the-wildest-song-any-actress-has-done-deepika/777015/ |archivedate=22 December 2015 |df=}}{{cite web |url=http://www.sify.com/movies/case-against-dum-maaro-dum-for-indecency-news-national-leswuobjjgf.html |title=Case against 'Dum Maaro Dum' for indecency |work=The Indian Express |accessdate=27 April 2011 |date=18 April 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110419180348/http://www.sify.com/movies/case-against-dum-maaro-dum-for-indecency-news-national-leswuobjjgf.html |archivedate=19 April 2011 |df=}} Her next film was [[Prakash Jha]]'s socio-political drama ''[[Aarakshan]]'', co-starring [[Amitabh Bachchan]], Saif Ali Khan, [[Manoj Bajpayee]] and [[Prateik Babbar]], which dealt with the political issue of [[Reservation in India|caste-based reservations in India]]. Trade journalists had high expectations for the film which ultimately flopped at the box office.{{cite web |title=Will Aarakshan draw in the crowds? |url=http://www.rediff.com/movies/report/will-aarakshan-draw-in-the-crowds/20110801.htm |publisher=Rediff.com |accessdate=4 April 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150203184214/http://www.rediff.com/movies/report/will-aarakshan-draw-in-the-crowds/20110801.htm |archivedate=3 February 2015 |df=}}{{cite web |title=It's raining flops at the box office |url=http://www.rediff.com/movies/report/raining-flops-at-box-office/20110919.htm |publisher=Rediff.com |accessdate=4 April 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120429131112/http://www.rediff.com/movies/report/raining-flops-at-box-office/20110919.htm |archivedate=29 April 2012 |df=}} Critical reaction was largely negative, though [[Pratim D. Gupta]] mentioned Padukone as the most "refreshing thing about [the] movie."{{cite news |title=Aarakshan loses plot after second half |date=12 August 2011 |url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/bollywood/aarakshan-loses-plot-after-second-half/story-MxH4SLWdr8jzU3Jr2lUFUP.html |accessdate=13 August 2012 |work=Hindustan Times |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160203133341/http://www.hindustantimes.com/bollywood/aarakshan-loses-plot-after-second-half/story-MxH4SLWdr8jzU3Jr2lUFUP.html |archivedate=3 February 2016 |df=}}{{cite news |author=Gupta, Pratim D. |title=Aarakshan – Film Review |date=13 August 2011 |url=http://www.telegraphindia.com/1110813/jsp/entertainment/story_14372488.jsp |accessdate=13 August 2012 |work=The Telegraph |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121102175641/http://www.telegraphindia.com/1110813/jsp/entertainment/story_14372488.jsp |archivedate=2 November 2012 |df=}} Her final appearance that year was in Rohit Dhawan's comedy-drama ''[[Desi Boyz]]'' alongside Akshay Kumar, [[John Abraham (actor)|John Abraham]] and [[Chitrangada Singh]], a role that failed to propel her career forward.{{cite web |title=Review: Desi Boyz |url=http://movies.ndtv.com/movie-reviews/review-desi-boyz-676 |publisher=NDTV |accessdate=12 August 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130917011435/http://movies.ndtv.com/movie-reviews/review-desi-boyz-676 |archivedate=17 September 2013 |df=}}{{cite web |last=Tuteja |first=Joginder |title=Exploring the Box Office journey of Deepika Padukone – Part III |url=http://www.bollywoodhungama.com/movies/features/type/view/id/5360 |publisher=Bollywood Hungama |date=12 August 2013 |accessdate=12 August 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130814144827/http://www.bollywoodhungama.com/movies/features/type/view/id/5360 |archivedate=14 August 2013 |df=}} The series of poorly received films led critics to perceive that Padukone had "[lost] her sparkle."{{cite news |last=Pal |first=Chandrima |url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2013-06-17/news-interviews/40009313_1_deepika-padukone-cocktail-and-deepika-imtiaz-ali |title=The making of Deepika Padukone |accessdate=27 July 2013 |date=17 June 2013 |newspaper=The Times of India}} ===Establishing with romantic comedies and ''Ram-Leela'' (2012–2014)=== In an interview for ''[[The Indian Express]]'', Padukone said that her starring role in the 2012 [[Homi Adajania]]-directed romantic comedy ''[[Cocktail (2012 film)|Cocktail]]'' marked a significant turning point in her career.{{cite news |last=Singh |first=Harneet |url=http://archive.indianexpress.com/news/deepika-padukone-ranbir-kapoor-excites-me-as-an-actor-costar/1126038/0 |title=Deepika Padukone: Ranbir Kapoor excites me as an actor, co-star |work=The Indian Express |date=7 June 2013 |accessdate=10 August 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140222152538/http://archive.indianexpress.com/news/deepika-padukone-ranbir-kapoor-excites-me-as-an-actor-costar/1126038/0 |archivedate=22 February 2014 |df=}} Raja Sen of Rediff.com opined that she had successfully proved to be a "stunning girl who can also act."{{cite web |last=Sen |first=Raja |url=http://www.rediff.com/movies/slide-show/slide-show-1-hows-these-bollywood-actresses-fared-in-2012/20130102.htm#3 |title=Report Card, 2012: How Kat, Kareena, Deepika performed |accessdate=27 July 2013 |date=2 January 2013 |publisher=Rediff.com |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130508185019/http://www.rediff.com/movies/slide-show/slide-show-1-hows-these-bollywood-actresses-fared-in-2012/20130102.htm |archivedate=8 May 2013 |df=}} Set in London, ''Cocktail'' tells the story of a software engineer (played by Saif Ali Khan) and his relationship with two temperamentally different women{{mdash}}an impulsive party girl (Veronica, played by Padukone) and a submissive [[girl next door]] (Meera, played by [[Diana Penty]]). During the script narration, the producer Dinesh Vijan offered Padukone the choice of which woman to play; she decided on Veronica to expand her horizons as an actress.{{cite news |url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/bollywood/veronica-is-no-meera-deepika-padukone/story-QfD3KilX3eevBOtuKJkznO.html |title=Veronica is no Meera: Deepika |work=Hindustan Times |date=25 May 2012 |accessdate=10 August 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160808003227/http://www.hindustantimes.com/bollywood/veronica-is-no-meera-deepika-padukone/story-QfD3KilX3eevBOtuKJkznO.html |archivedate=8 August 2016 |df=}} Portraying the role was a creative and physical challenge for her, and to achieve the physical requirements of her character she exercised extensively and followed a rigorous diet.{{cite news |url=http://archive.indianexpress.com/news/playing-veronica-in-cocktail-was-challenging-deepika-padukone/970790/0 |title=Playing Veronica in 'Cocktail' was challenging: Deepika Padukone |work=The Indian Express |date=5 May 2012 |accessdate=10 August 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=http://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/20130811102927/http://archive.indianexpress.com/news/playing-veronica-in-cocktail-was-challenging-deepika-padukone/970790/0 |archivedate=11 August 2013}}{{cite news |url=http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/cocktail-deepika-padukone-daina-penty-saif-ali-khan/1/207582.html |title=Was conscious about my look in Cocktail: Deepika |work=India Today |date=11 May 2012 |accessdate=10 August 2013 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6JwCBnq5n?url=http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/cocktail-deepika-padukone-daina-penty-saif-ali-khan/1/207582.html |archivedate=27 September 2013 |deadurl=yes}} Critics were divided in their opinion of the film, but particularly praised Padukone's performance;{{cite news |url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/bollywood/critics-verdict-cocktail-works-but-in-bits/story-cFNQiVGyPXFUTKmsSUSBEN.html |title=Critics verdict: Cocktail works, but in bits |work=Hindustan Times |date=13 July 2013 |accessdate=7 October 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304122353/http://www.hindustantimes.com/bollywood/critics-verdict-cocktail-works-but-in-bits/story-cFNQiVGyPXFUTKmsSUSBEN.html |archivedate=4 March 2016 |df=}} Devesh Sharma of ''[[Filmfare]]'' credited her as the "soul of the film" and wrote that she "excels in every scene, whether as a material girl who enjoys sex, drugs and rock and roll or as the jealousy ridden girl out to destroy herself."{{cite news |last=Sharma |first=Devesh |title=Movie Review: Cocktail |url=http://www.filmfare.com/reviews/movie-review-cocktail-840.html |work=[[Filmfare]] |date=13 May 2012 |accessdate=29 June 2013 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6JwAglv9h?url=http://www.filmfare.com/reviews/movie-review-cocktail-840.html |archivedate=27 September 2013 |deadurl=yes}} ''Cocktail'' earned Padukone Best Actress nominations at several award ceremonies, including Filmfare, [[Screen Award|Screen]], and [[IIFA Awards|IIFA]].{{cite web |url=http://www.bollywoodhungama.com/celebritymicro/awards/id/1856 |title=Deepika Padukone — Awards |accessdate=5 September 2013 |publisher=Bollywood Hungama |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6JwCqDjGs?url=http://www.bollywoodhungama.com/celebritymicro/awards/id/1856 |archivedate=27 September 2013 |deadurl=yes}} The film proved to be a box office hit as well.{{cite web |title=Box Office Earnings 10/08/12 – 16/08/12 |url=http://www.boxofficeindia.com/cpages.php?pageName=earnings |publisher=Box Office India |accessdate=9 September 2013 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120825191030/http://www.boxofficeindia.com/cpages.php?pageName=earnings |archivedate=25 August 2012}} In 2013, Padukone established herself as a leading actress of contemporary Hindi cinema by featuring in four of the [[List of Bollywood films of 2013|top-grossing productions of the year]].{{cite news |title=Deepika Padukone races to the top as top actress in Bollywood |last=Tanwar |first=Sarita |url=http://www.dnaindia.com/entertainment/report-deepika-padukone-races-to-the-top-as-top-actress-in-bollywood-1858364 |accessdate=8 July 2013 |newspaper=Daily News and Analysis |date=10 August 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131220024053/http://www.dnaindia.com/entertainment/report-deepika-padukone-races-to-the-top-as-top-actress-in-bollywood-1858364 |archivedate=20 December 2013 |df=}}{{cite news |last=Goyal |first=Divya |title=Deepika Padukone lucky fourth time with 'Ram-Leela' |url=http://archive.indianexpress.com/news/deepika-padukone-lucky-fourth-time-with-ramleela/1196368/ |accessdate=4 December 2013 |newspaper=The Indian Express |date=18 November 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140222152120/http://archive.indianexpress.com/news/deepika-padukone-lucky-fourth-time-with-ramleela/1196368/ |archivedate=22 February 2014 |df=}} She collaborated with Saif Ali Khan for the fourth time (alongside John Abraham and [[Jacqueline Fernandez]]) in [[Abbas-Mustan]]'s ''[[Race 2]]'', an ensemble action thriller that served as a sequel to ''[[Race (2008 film)|Race]]'' (2008). The film received predominantly negative reviews,{{cite news |title=Critics report: Race 2 not worth it |url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/bollywood/critics-report-race-2-not-worth-it/story-QhSKezAX1YGfNcpJEyKCTJ.html |accessdate=9 March 2013 |newspaper=Hindustan Times |date=25 January 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304081019/http://www.hindustantimes.com/bollywood/critics-report-race-2-not-worth-it/story-QhSKezAX1YGfNcpJEyKCTJ.html |archivedate=4 March 2016 |df=}} but with a total collection of {{INRConvert|1.62|b}}, it proved to be a commercial success.{{cite web |url=http://www.boxofficeindia.com/boxnewsdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=6308&nCat= |title=Worldwide Top Ten 2013 |publisher=Box Office India |accessdate=12 December 2013 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140104212753/http://www.boxofficeindia.com/boxnewsdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=6308&nCat= |archivedate=4 January 2014}}{{cite news |title=Deepika Padukone on cloud 9, Chennai Express, Ram-Leela, Yeh Jawaani Hai Deewani, Race 2 big hits of 2013 |url=http://www.financialexpress.com/news/happy-birthday-deepika-padukone-on-cloud-9-chennai-express-ramleela-yeh-jawaani-hai-deewani-race-2-big-hits-of-2013/1215689?rhheader |accessdate=26 January 2014 |newspaper=The Financial Express |date=5 January 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140201194525/http://www.financialexpress.com/news/happy-birthday-deepika-padukone-on-cloud-9-chennai-express-ramleela-yeh-jawaani-hai-deewani-race-2-big-hits-of-2013/1215689?rhheader |archivedate=1 February 2014 |df=}} In a scathing review, Saibal Chatterjee of NDTV wrote that both Padukone and Fernandez "strut around like wound-up automatons that are all decked-up but have nowhere to go."{{cite web |last=Chatterjee |first=Saibal |title=Movie review: Race 2 |url=http://movies.ndtv.com/movie-reviews/movie-review-race-2-775 |publisher=NDTV |date=25 January 2013 |accessdate=10 August 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160313162245/http://movies.ndtv.com/movie-reviews/movie-review-race-2-775 |archivedate=13 March 2016 |df=}} [[File:Ranveer-Deepika at Ram Leela screening.jpg|thumb|right|upright=1|alt=Ranveer Singh and Deepika Padukone smiling for the camera|Padukone and [[Ranveer Singh]] at an event for ''[[Goliyon Ki Raasleela Ram-Leela]]'' in 2013. She was awarded her first [[Filmfare Award for Best Actress]] for her performance in the film.]] [[Ayan Mukerji]]'s romantic comedy ''[[Yeh Jawaani Hai Deewani]]'' was Padukone's next film release. Co-starring opposite Ranbir Kapoor, she was cast as Naina Talwar, a "shy wallflower," which marked a departure from the glamorous characters that she had a reputation for portraying.{{cite news |last=KBR |first=Upala |url=http://www.dnaindia.com/entertainment/report-party-girl-deepika-padukone-gets-serious-1819664 |title=Party girl Deepika Padukone gets serious |accessdate=17 August 2013 |date=7 April 2013 |newspaper=Daily News and Analysis |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141014003716/http://www.dnaindia.com/entertainment/report-party-girl-deepika-padukone-gets-serious-1819664 |archivedate=14 October 2014 |df=}} Film critics praised her performance, though their response to the film was mixed.{{cite news |title=Critics' review: Yeh Jawaani Hai Deewani is riddled with clichés |url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/bollywood/critics-review-yeh-jawaani-hai-deewani-is-riddled-with-cliches/story-oJ42cqGvHsPaDwUcMS746O.html |accessdate=15 June 2013 |newspaper=Hindustan Times |date=31 May 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151222143942/http://www.hindustantimes.com/bollywood/critics-review-yeh-jawaani-hai-deewani-is-riddled-with-cliches/story-oJ42cqGvHsPaDwUcMS746O.html |archivedate=22 December 2015 |df=}} Raja Sen thought that the film "lacked a good story" but added that Padukone "acts within herself and eschews exaggeration, and the results are impressive ... This may be her most self-aware performance so far".{{cite web |last=Sen |first=Raja |title=Review: Yeh Jawaani Hai Deewani disappoints |url=http://www.rediff.com/movies/review/review-yeh-jawaani-hai-deewani-disappoints/20130531.htm |publisher=Rediff.com |accessdate=31 May 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130606072818/http://www.rediff.com/movies/review/review-yeh-jawaani-hai-deewani-disappoints/20130531.htm |archivedate=6 June 2013 |df=}} The pairing of Padukone with her former boyfriend was anticipated,{{cite news |title=Younger generation should learn from Ranbir & Deepika: Ayan |url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2013-06-01/news-interviews/39674323_1_ayan-mukerji-yeh-jawaani-hai-deewani-deepika-padukone |author=Risbood, Vaibhavi |work=The Times of India |date=1 June 2013 |accessdate=12 July 2013}} and the film emerged as a major commercial success.{{cite news |title=Yeh Jawaani Hai Deewani is Ranbir Kapoor, Deepika Padukone's biggest hit |url=http://archive.indianexpress.com/news/yeh-jawaani-hai-deewani-is-ranbir-kapoor-deepika-padukone-s-biggest-hit/1127672/ |accessdate=1 July 2013 |work=The Indian Express |date=1 July 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140222152212/http://archive.indianexpress.com/news/yeh-jawaani-hai-deewani-is-ranbir-kapoor-deepika-padukone-s-biggest-hit/1127672/ |archivedate=22 February 2014 |df=}} Her next appearance was opposite Shah Rukh Khan in [[Rohit Shetty]]'s action-comedy film ''[[Chennai Express]]''. She played Meenalochini Azhagusundaram, a [[Tamil people|Tamil girl]] on the run from her father (a local [[boss (crime)|don]]), which required that she adopt a Tamil accent. Critical opinion on her accent was mixed,{{cite news |title=Not spoofing South India in Chennai Express: Deepika Padukone |url=http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/not-spoofing-south-india-in-chennai-express-says-deepika-padukone/1/298317.html |accessdate=13 August 2013 |work=India Today |date=6 August 2013 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6JwCFXjFR?url=http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/not-spoofing-south-india-in-chennai-express-says-deepika-padukone/1/298317.html |archivedate=27 September 2013 |deadurl=yes}} but her performance received praise;{{cite news |last=Uniyal |first=Parmita |title=Deepika Padukone rides on a high graph express |url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/entertainment/bollywood/deepika-padukone-gets-critical-acclaim-rides-on-a-high-graph-express/article1-1107578.aspx |accessdate=13 August 2013 |work=Hindustan Times |date=13 August 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140101105157/http://www.hindustantimes.com/entertainment/bollywood/deepika-padukone-gets-critical-acclaim-rides-on-a-high-graph-express/article1-1107578.aspx |archivedate=1 January 2014 |df=}} film critic Aseem Chhabra wrote, "Padukone is delightful in the film{{mdash}}beautiful, smiling, and often a lot more playful and funny than Khan."{{cite web |last=Chhabra |first=Aseem |title=Aseem Chhabra's Chennai Express Review: Mindless but entertaining |url=http://www.rediff.com/movies/review/aseem-chhabras-chennai-express-review-mindless-but-entertaining/20130809.htm |publisher=Rediff |date=9 August 2013 |accessdate=10 August 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130811184158/http://www.rediff.com/movies/review/aseem-chhabras-chennai-express-review-mindless-but-entertaining/20130809.htm |archivedate=11 August 2013 |df=}} ''Chennai Express'' earned over {{INRConvert|3.95|b}} to emerge as Padukone's highest-grossing release to that point, and alongside ''Yeh Jawaani Hai Deewani'' it ranks among the [[List of highest-grossing Indian films|highest-grossing Indian films]] of all time.{{cite web |title=Top Worldwide Grossers All Time |url=http://boxofficeindia.com/worldwide-total-gross.php |publisher=Box Office India |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180107113404/http://boxofficeindia.com/worldwide-total-gross.php |archivedate=7 January 2018 |accessdate=5 February 2018 |deadurl=no |df=}} Padukone next played opposite [[Ranveer Singh]] in ''[[Goliyon Ki Raasleela Ram-Leela]]'', an adaptation of the [[Shakespearean tragedy]] of ''[[Romeo and Juliet]]'' from director [[Sanjay Leela Bhansali]]. Her role was Leela, a [[Gujarati people|Gujarati girl]] based on the character of [[Juliet]].{{cite news |title=First look Ram Leela: Meet Romeo Ranveer and Juliet Deepika |url=http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/first-poster-of-ram-leela-ranveer-singh-deepika-padukone/1/247370.html |work=India Today |accessdate=16 July 2013 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6JwCOFmHR?url=http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/first-poster-of-ram-leela-ranveer-singh-deepika-padukone/1/247370.html |archivedate=27 September 2013 |deadurl=yes}} Initially titled ''Ram-Leela'', the film's title was changed after a court case was registered against Bhansali, Padukone, and Singh for "offending the religious sentiments" of the Hindu community by showcasing sex and violence under a title that referred to the life of [[Rama]].{{cite news |last=Sura |first=Ajay |title=Controversy over 'Ram Leela': HC stays arrest of Bhansali, Ranveer and Deepika |url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2013-11-14/india/44073111_1_ram-leela-ranveer-singh-delhi-high-court |accessdate=16 November 2013 |newspaper=The Times of India |date=14 November 2013}} ''Goliyon Ki Raasleela Ram-Leela'' released among protests across several states in India, but was generally well received by critics.{{cite news |title=Ram-Leela faces protest in several states |url=http://www.dnaindia.com/entertainment/report-ram-leela-faces-protest-in-several-states-1919790 |accessdate=16 November 2013 |newspaper=Daily News and Analysis |date=15 November 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131118080509/http://www.dnaindia.com/entertainment/report-ram-leela-faces-protest-in-several-states-1919790 |archivedate=18 November 2013 |df=}}{{cite news |last=Uniyal |first=Parmita |title=Movie review: Bhansali's Ram-leela is his best ever, say critics |url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/bollywood/movie-review-bhansali-s-ram-leela-is-his-best-ever-say-critics/story-cdj9US9WMi2M58gcg56YNI.html |accessdate=15 November 2013 |newspaper=Hindustan Times |date=15 November 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304070929/http://www.hindustantimes.com/bollywood/movie-review-bhansali-s-ram-leela-is-his-best-ever-say-critics/story-cdj9US9WMi2M58gcg56YNI.html |archivedate=4 March 2016 |df=}} Meena Iyer of ''The Times of India'' mentioned Padukone as "breathtaking", and writing for ''[[Deccan Chronicle]]'', [[Khalid Mohamed]] concluded that "it’s Deepika Padukone whom the film belongs to. Looking drop dead gorgeous and going at her part with a wallop, she’s the prime asset of ''Ram-Leela''."{{cite news |last=Iyer |first=Meena |title=Ram-Leela |url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/movie-reviews/hindi/Ram-Leela/movie-review/25770699.cms |accessdate=15 November 2013 |newspaper=The Times of India |date=14 November 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131115000038/http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/movie-reviews/hindi/ram-leela/movie-review/25770699.cms |archivedate=15 November 2013 |df=}}{{cite news |last=Mohamed |first=Khalid |title='Ram-Leela' Review: The good, the bard and the beautiful |url=http://www.deccanchronicle.com/131115/entertainment-movie-reviews/article/ram-leela-review-good-bard-and-beautiful |accessdate=16 November 2013 |work=Deccan Chronicle |date=16 November 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131116102722/http://deccanchronicle.com/131115/entertainment-movie-reviews/article/ram-leela-review-good-bard-and-beautiful |archivedate=16 November 2013 |df=}} The film earned {{INRConvert|2.02|b}} worldwide, making it Padukone's fourth consecutive success of the year. Her performances in ''Chennai Express'' and ''Goliyon Ki Raasleela Ram-Leela'' won her several awards,{{cite news |title=Deepika is toast of this award season |url=http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/deepika-padukone-is-toast-of-this-award-season/1/343781.html |accessdate=16 February 2014 |work=India Today |date=17 February 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140216064856/http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/deepika-padukone-is-toast-of-this-award-season/1/343781.html |archivedate=16 February 2014 |df=}} including the [[Screen Award for Best Actress]] for both films and the Filmfare Award for Best Actress for the latter.{{cite web |title=Winners of 20th Annual Life OK Screen Awards |url=http://www.bollywoodhungama.com/movies/features/type/view/id/6026 |publisher=Bollywood Hungama |date=14 January 2014 |accessdate=17 February 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140116181505/http://www.bollywoodhungama.com/movies/features/type/view/id/6026 |archivedate=16 January 2014 |df=}}{{cite web |title=Filmfare Awards 2014: Deepika Padukone wins Best Actress award, Farhan Akhtar Best Actor |url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/filmfare-awards-2014-deepika-padukone-wins-best-actress-award-farhan-akhtar-best-actor/447639-8-66.html |publisher=CNN-IBN |date=25 January 2014 |accessdate=25 January 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140125110704/http://ibnlive.in.com/news/filmfare-awards-2014-deepika-padukone-wins-best-actress-award-farhan-akhtar-best-actor/447639-8-66.html |archivedate=25 January 2014 |df=}} In 2014, Padukone featured opposite [[Rajinikanth]] in the [[Tamil cinema|Tamil film]] ''[[Kochadaiiyaan]]'', a period drama that was shot using [[motion capture]] technology.{{cite news |url=http://www.financialexpress.com/news/kochadaiiyaan-released-nationwide-rajinikanth-turns-movemaking-pioneer-in-india/1253639 |title='Kochadaiiyaan' released nationwide, Rajinikanth turns moviemaking pioneer in India |work=[[The Financial Express (India)|The Financial Express]] |date=23 March 2014 |agency=Press Trust of India |accessdate=23 March 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140523230850/http://www.financialexpress.com/news/kochadaiiyaan-released-nationwide-rajinikanth-turns-movemaking-pioneer-in-india/1253639 |archivedate=23 May 2014 |df=}} She was paid {{INRConvert|30|m}} for two days worth of work in it.{{cite web |url=http://zeenews.india.com/entertainment/movies/deepika-padukone-films-rajinikanth-s-kochadaiiyaan-for-two-days-only_143262.html |title=Deepika Padukone shoots Rajinikanth’s `Kochadaiiyaan` for two days only! |publisher=Zee News |date=23 September 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130926173744/http://zeenews.india.com/entertainment/movies/deepika-padukone-films-rajinikanth-s-kochadaiiyaan-for-two-days-only_143262.html |archivedate=26 September 2013 |df=}}{{cite news |url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/bollywood/news-interviews/Deepika-gets-3-cr-for-2-day-shoot-in-Rajnis-film/articleshow/22508894.cms |title=Deepika gets 3 cr for 2 day shoot in Rajni’s film? |work=The Times of India |date=12 September 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130912235545/http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/bollywood/news-interviews/Deepika-gets-3-cr-for-2-day-shoot-in-Rajnis-film/articleshow/22508894.cms |archivedate=12 September 2013 |df=}} In Homi Adajania's widely praised satire ''[[Finding Fanny]]'', Padukone played a young widow who takes a road trip with her dysfunctional friends (played by [[Arjun Kapoor]], [[Naseeruddin Shah]], [[Dimple Kapadia]] and [[Pankaj Kapur]]) in search of a woman named Fanny.{{cite news |last=Mehta |first=Ankita |url=http://www.ibtimes.co.in/finding-fanny-movie-review-must-watch-film-brilliant-performances-608764 |title='Finding Fanny' Movie Review: Must Watch Film with Brilliant Performances |date=10 September 2014 |work=[[International Business Times]] |accessdate=12 September 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140911015405/http://www.ibtimes.co.in/finding-fanny-movie-review-must-watch-film-brilliant-performances-608764 |archivedate=11 September 2014 |df=}} The film was screened at the [[19th Busan International Film Festival]];{{cite news |last=Vyavahare |first=Renuka |title=Finding Fanny selected for Busan Film Festival |url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/news/Finding-Fanny-selected-for-Busan-Film-Festival/articleshow/41878021.cms |accessdate=12 September 2014 |work=The Times of India |date=6 September 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140909044509/http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/news/Finding-Fanny-selected-for-Busan-Film-Festival/articleshow/41878021.cms |archivedate=9 September 2014 |df=}} critic Anuj Kumar of ''[[The Hindu]]'' wrote that Padukone successfully "takes off the fineries of Bollywood and you can sense the freedom from baggage in her performance".{{cite news |last=Kumar |first=Anuj |title=Finding fanny: Lost and found |url=http://www.thehindu.com/features/cinema/finding-fanny-review/article6404665.ece |work=The Hindu |accessdate=29 November 2014 |date=12 September 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141205215445/http://www.thehindu.com/features/cinema/finding-fanny-review/article6404665.ece |archivedate=5 December 2014 |df=}} Later that year, she starred opposite Shah Rukh Khan for the third time in Farah Khan's renewal of ''Happy New Year''. She played a bar dancer who trains a group of underachievers for a dance competition. Sanjukta Sharma of ''[[Mint (newspaper)|Mint]]'' found her role to be of minimal importance that required her only to be "a pretty thing to be laughed at and pitied", but the film became one of her most successful, earning over {{INRConvert|3.4|b}} worldwide.{{cite news |last=Sharma |first=Sanjukta |url=http://www.livemint.com/Leisure/RbQFYNOCmIXFirlKS1t0kI/Film-Review--Happy-New-Year.html |title=Film Review Happy New Year |date=4 September 2013 |accessdate=24 October 2014 |work=[[Mint (newspaper)|Mint]] |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141024170656/http://www.livemint.com/Leisure/RbQFYNOCmIXFirlKS1t0kI/Film-Review--Happy-New-Year.html |archivedate=24 October 2014 |df=}} ===''Piku'' and period films with Sanjay Leela Bhansali (2015–present)=== Following an appearance in Homi Adajania's online video on [[Feminism in India|feminism]], entitled ''My Choice'',{{cite news |title=Deepika Padukone: Bollywood actress urges women to own their 'choice' over marriage, sex and sexuality |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/people/deepika-padukone-bollywood-actress-urges-women-to-own-their-choice-over-marriage-sex-and-sexuality-10145843.html |work=[[The Independent]] |date=31 March 2015 |accessdate=1 April 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150331183715/http://www.independent.co.uk/news/people/deepika-padukone-bollywood-actress-urges-women-to-own-their-choice-over-marriage-sex-and-sexuality-10145843.html |archivedate=31 March 2015 |df=}} Padukone took on the role of a headstrong [[Bengali people|Bengali]] architect who cares for her hypochondriac father (played by Amitabh Bachchan), in [[Shoojit Sircar]]'s comedy-drama ''[[Piku]]'' (2015). She was drawn to the depiction of a realistic father-daughter bond, which she thought was rare in Hindi cinema.{{cite news |last=Ratnam |first=Dhamini |title=Objectifying me, that is not done: Deepika Padukone |url=http://www.business-standard.com/article/specials/film-review-piku-is-a-quietly-brilliant-film-115050800287_1.html |work=Mint |date=27 December 2014 |accessdate=25 January 2018 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160509232711/http://www.business-standard.com/article/specials/film-review-piku-is-a-quietly-brilliant-film-115050800287_1.html |archivedate=9 May 2016}} Reviews for the film were positive;{{cite web |last=Mehta |first=Ankita |title='Piku' Review Roundup: A Film that's all Heart |url=http://www.ibtimes.co.in/piku-review-roundup-simple-classy-charming-film-631700 |work=International Business Times |date=7 May 2015 |accessdate=10 May 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150509200624/http://www.ibtimes.co.in/piku-review-roundup-simple-classy-charming-film-631700 |archivedate=9 May 2015 |df=}} Tanmaya Nanda of ''[[Business Standard]]'' praised the film's feminist tone, and wrote that Padukone proves "what she is capable of when given something more to do than look pretty and be the crazy-dance girl at parties".{{cite news |last=Nanda |first=Tanmaya |title=Film Review: Piku is a delightfully brilliant film |url=http://www.business-standard.com/article/specials/film-review-piku-is-a-quietly-brilliant-film-115050800287_1.html |work=[[Business Standard]] |date=8 May 2015 |accessdate=9 May 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160509232711/http://www.business-standard.com/article/specials/film-review-piku-is-a-quietly-brilliant-film-115050800287_1.html |archivedate=9 May 2016 |df=}} NDTV's Saibal Chatterjee opined that she "holds ''Piku'' together with a restrained star turn".{{cite web |last=Chatterjee |first=Saibal |title=Piku Movie Review |url=http://movies.ndtv.com/movie-reviews/piku-movie-review-1124 |publisher=NDTV |date=8 May 2015 |accessdate=10 May 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150510190128/http://movies.ndtv.com/movie-reviews/piku-movie-review-1124 |archivedate=10 May 2015 |df=}} With a worldwide gross of over {{INRConvert|1.40|b}}, ''Piku'' emerged as a box office hit, and garnered Padukone several awards, including second Best Actress awards at Filmfare and Screen.{{cite news |title=Victory dance for Team 'Bajirao Mastani' at the Filmfare Awards |url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/news/Victory-dance-for-Team-Bajirao-Mastani-at-the-Filmfare-Awards/articleshow/50604444.cms |accessdate=24 January 2016 |work=The Times of India |date=17 January 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160121183819/http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/news/Victory-dance-for-Team-Bajirao-Mastani-at-the-Filmfare-Awards/articleshow/50604444.cms |archivedate=21 January 2016 |df=}}{{cite web |last=Ghosh |first=Raya |title=Screen Awards 2016: Complete List of Winners |url=http://movies.ndtv.com/bollywood/screen-awards-2016-complete-list-of-winners-1263815 |publisher=NDTV |accessdate=9 January 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160110051251/http://movies.ndtv.com/bollywood/screen-awards-2016-complete-list-of-winners-1263815 |archivedate=10 January 2016 |df=}} [[File:Deepika at the press conference of ‘Bajirao Mastani’.jpg|thumb|left|upright=0.9|alt=A headshot shot of Deepika Padukone|Padukone at an event for ''[[Bajirao Mastani]]'' in 2015. The film ranks among her highest-grossing releases.]] Later in 2015, Padukone played the part of a businessperson who helps Ranbir Kapoor's character overcome his conflicts in Imtiaz Ali's romantic drama ''[[Tamasha (2015 film)|Tamasha]]''. Despite poor financial returns, Sukanya Verma of Rediff.com named Padukone's performance as the best by an actress that year, writing that she "is so potent in ''Tamasha'', it’s almost as if you can hear her heartbeat across the screen".{{cite news |last=Khuranaa |first=Amann |title=Deepika Padukone reacts to Tamasha's box-office failure |url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/news/Deepika-Padukone-reacts-to-Tamashas-box-office-failure/articleshow/50186402.cms |accessdate=24 January 2016 |work=The Times of India |date=15 December 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151218163236/http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/news/Deepika-Padukone-reacts-to-Tamashas-box-office-failure/articleshow/50186402.cms |archivedate=18 December 2015 |df=}}{{cite web |last=Verma |first=Sukanya |title=Sukanya Verma's Best Actresses of 2015 |url=http://www.rediff.com/movies/report/sukanya-vermas-best-actresses-of-2015/20151224.htm |date=24 December 2015 |publisher=Rediff.com |accessdate=24 January 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160123175703/http://www.rediff.com/movies/report/sukanya-vermas-best-actresses-of-2015/20151224.htm |archivedate=23 January 2016 |df=}} In her final release of 2015, Padukone reunited with Sanjay Leela Bhansali and Ranveer Singh in ''[[Bajirao Mastani]]'', a historical drama about a tragic extramarital affair. Singh was cast as the [[maratha]] general [[Bajirao I]], while [[Priyanka Chopra]] and Padukone featured as his first and second wife, respectively. To play the warrior-princess [[Mastani]], Padukone learnt sword-fighting, horse-riding, and the martial art form of [[kalaripayattu]].{{cite news |last=Awaasthi |first=Kavita |url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/bollywood/deepika-padukone-to-learn-sword-fighting-for-bajirao-mastani/story-KUjvxij1mi4pBQyOLkzWrM.html |title=Deepika Padukone to learn sword-fighting for Bajirao Mastani |work=Hindutan Times |date=23 January 2015 |accessdate=19 December 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151222163238/http://www.hindustantimes.com/bollywood/deepika-padukone-to-learn-sword-fighting-for-bajirao-mastani/story-KUjvxij1mi4pBQyOLkzWrM.html |archivedate=22 December 2015 |df=}} With a revenue of over {{INRConvert|3.5|b}}, ''Bajirao Mastani'' proved to be the [[List of Bollywood films of 2015|fourth highest-grossing Bollywood film of the year]]. [[Anupama Chopra]] found Padukone "riveting", but [[Subhash K. Jha]] thought that she was "way too subtle and silken, and not steely enough".{{cite news |last=Chopra |first=Anupama |title=Bajirao Mastani review by Anupama Chopra: Soaring, searing, sumptuous |url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/movie-reviews/bajirao-mastani-review-by-anupama-chopra-soaring-searing-sumptuous/story-gZmskukJnTmbRtcS15D3XK.html |accessdate=24 January 2016 |work=Hindustan Times |date=22 December 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160116085552/http://www.hindustantimes.com/movie-reviews/bajirao-mastani-review-by-anupama-chopra-soaring-searing-sumptuous/story-gZmskukJnTmbRtcS15D3XK.html |archivedate=16 January 2016 |df=}}{{cite web |last=Jha |first=Subhash K. |title=Subhash K Jha speaks about Bajirao Mastani |date=19 December 2015 |url=http://www.bollywoodhungama.com/movies/features/type/view/id/9439 |publisher=Bollywood Hungama |accessdate=24 January 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160119175354/http://www.bollywoodhungama.com/movies/features/type/view/id/9439 |archivedate=19 January 2016 |df=}} The film was showcased at the [[International Film Festival of India]];{{cite web |url=http://dff.nic.in/writereaddata/IP_press_release_2016_Final.pdf |title=Indian Panorama Selections for 47th International Film Festival of India , 2016: Press Release|access-date=25 July 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161112080152/http://dff.nic.in/writereaddata/IP_press_release_2016_Final.pdf |archivedate=12 November 2016}} at the [[61st Filmfare Awards]], ''Bajirao Mastani'' was named [[Filmfare Award for Best Film|Best Film]] and Padukone received her second Best Actress nomination in that year.{{cite news |title=Nominations for the 61st Britannia Filmfare Awards |url=http://www.filmfare.com/news/nominations-for-the-61st-britannia-filmfare-awards-11809.html |accessdate=24 January 2016 |work=Filmfare |date=11 January 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6gO32fdDO?url=http://www.filmfare.com/news/nominations-for-the-61st-britannia-filmfare-awards-11809.html |archivedate=30 March 2016 |df=}} The action film ''[[xXx: Return of Xander Cage]]'' (2017), in which Padukone played the lead female role of Serena Unger, opposite [[Vin Diesel]], marked her first project in [[Cinema of the United States|Hollywood]].{{cite web |last=Goyal |first=Divya |title=Deepika Padukone Wraps xXx 3 Shoot and in Such Style |url=http://movies.ndtv.com/hollywood/deepika-padukone-wraps-xxx-3-shoot-and-in-such-style-1405905 |publisher=NDTV |date=13 May 2016 |accessdate=14 May 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160513123136/http://movies.ndtv.com/hollywood/deepika-padukone-wraps-xxx-3-shoot-and-in-such-style-1405905 |archivedate=13 May 2016 |df=}} Critical reception of the film was mixed.{{cite web |url=https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/xxx_return_of_xander_cage |title=xXx: Return of Xander Cage (2017) |publisher=Rotten Tomatoes |accessdate=20 January 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170119223913/https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/xxx_return_of_xander_cage |archivedate=19 January 2017 |df=}} Tirdad Derakhshani of ''[[The Philadelphia Inquirer]]'' termed the film a "repetitious heap of remarkably tedious CGI-enhanced action scenes" and thought that Padukone's talent was wasted in it.{{cite news |last=Derakhshani |first=Tirdad |url=http://www.philly.com/philly/entertainment/movies/Vin-Diesels-xXx.html |title=Vin Diesel’s ‘xXx: Return of Xander Cage’: Abysmal, unwatchable , embarrassing |work=[[The Philadelphia Inquirer]] |date=20 January 2017 |accessdate=20 January 2017}} Conversely, Frank Scheck of ''[[The Hollywood Reporter]]'' believed that she had successfully "outclassed" Diesel to "practically [steal] the film".{{cite news |last=Scheck |first=Frank |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/review/xxx-return-xander-review-965998 |title='xXx: Return of Xander Cage': Film Review |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |date=19 January 2017 |accessdate=20 January 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170120024920/http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/review/xxx-return-xander-review-965998 |archivedate=20 January 2017 |df=}} The film earned over US$345 million worldwide, a majority of which came from the Chinese box office.{{cite web |url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/movies/?id=xxx3.htm |title=xXx: Return of Xander Cage |publisher=Box Office Mojo |accessdate=8 April 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170329021315/http://www.boxofficemojo.com/movies/?id=xxx3.htm |archivedate=29 March 2017 |df=}} Padukone received three nominations at the [[Teen Choice Awards]] and followed it with an item number in the romantic drama ''[[Raabta (film)|Raabta]]''.{{cite news |url=http://www.teenvogue.com/story/teen-choice-awards-2017-nominees |title=Teen Choice Awards 2017: See the First Wave of Nominations |last=Ceron |first=Ella |work=[[Teen Vogue]] |date=19 June 2017 |accessdate=20 June 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6rLtVsNex?url=http://www.teenvogue.com/story/teen-choice-awards-2017-nominees |archivedate=20 June 2017}}{{Cite news |last=Shcherbakova |first=Lisa |url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/7865210/teen-choice-awards-2017-nominations-second-wave |title=Selena Gomez Leads Second Wave of Teen Choice Awards 2017 Nominations |work=Billboard |date=12 July 2017|access-date=14 July 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170714060829/http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/7865210/teen-choice-awards-2017-nominations-second-wave |archivedate=14 July 2017}}{{cite news |title=Watch: Deepika Padukone takes flexibility to a new level for dance number in 'Raabta' |url=http://www.dnaindia.com/entertainment/report-watch-deepika-padukone-takes-flexibility-to-a-new-level-for-dance-number-in-raabta-2218761 |work=Daily News and Analysis |date=1 June 2016 |accessdate=2 June 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160602145415/http://www.dnaindia.com/entertainment/report-watch-deepika-padukone-takes-flexibility-to-a-new-level-for-dance-number-in-raabta-2218761 |archivedate=2 June 2016 |df=}} In 2018, Padukone portrayed [[Rani Padmini|Rani Padmavati]], a [[Rajput]] queen who commits ''[[jauhar]]'' (self-immolation) to protect herself from the [[Muslim]] invader [[Alauddin Khalji|Alauddin Khilji]], in the period drama ''[[Padmaavat]]''; it marked her third collaboration with Bhansali and Singh.{{cite news |title=It's official! Sanjay Leela Bhansali's Padmavati to release in 2017 |url=http://www.filmfare.com/news/its-official-sanjay-leela-bhansalis-padmavati-to-release-in-2017_-16000.html |work=Filmfare |date=10 October 2016 |accessdate=10 October 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161011140218/http://www.filmfare.com/news/its-official-sanjay-leela-bhansalis-padmavati-to-release-in-2017_-16000.html |archivedate=11 October 2016 |df=}} She was challenged by the need to convey her character's courage through silence and considered it to be the most emotionally exhausting role of her career.{{cite news |last=Singh |first=Raghuvendra |url=https://www.filmfare.com/news/bollywood/the-empress-strikes-back-25241.html |title=Deepika Padukone chats with Filmfare about Padmavati, Ranveer Singh & more in her exclusive interview |date=24 November 2017 |work=Filmfare |accessdate=25 January 2018 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180125193654/https://www.filmfare.com/news/bollywood/the-empress-strikes-back-25241.html |archivedate=25 January 2018}} She read history books on the era and researched the various historical depictions of Padmavati. [[Saffron terror|Right-wing Hindu groups]] speculated that the film portrayed a romantic liaison between Padmavati and Khilji; they protested violently and placed a bounty to behead Padukone and Bhansali.{{cite news |last=Ray |first=Saptarshi |title=Bounty placed on Bollywood actress' head after Hindu-Muslim film outrage |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2017/11/17/bounty-placed-bollywood-actress-head-hindu-muslim-film-outrage/ |work=[[The Daily Telegraph]] |date=17 November 2017 |accessdate=2 December 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171118052745/http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2017/11/17/bounty-placed-bollywood-actress-head-hindu-muslim-film-outrage/ |archivedate=18 November 2017}} Following a deferment in release, the film was cleared for exhibition after several modifications were made to it.{{cite news |title=Padmavati release deferred after protests, Sanjay Leela Bhansali film not to come out on Dec 1 |url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/bollywood/padmavati-release-postponed-not-to-come-out-on-december-1/story-AAMT5dPtRloBAmSdqR4NRL.html |accessdate=19 November 2017 |work=Hindustan Times |date=19 November 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171119113357/http://www.hindustantimes.com/bollywood/padmavati-release-postponed-not-to-come-out-on-december-1/story-AAMT5dPtRloBAmSdqR4NRL.html |archivedate=19 November 2017}}{{cite web |url=https://www.ndtv.com/india-news/film-padmavati-to-get-ua-certificate-title-may-be-changed-to-padmavat-1793855 |title=Censor Board Wants "Padmavati" Renamed "Padmavat", 5 Changes To Film |publisher=NDTV |date=30 December 2017 |accessdate=30 December 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171230133652/https://www.ndtv.com/india-news/film-padmavati-to-get-ua-certificate-title-may-be-changed-to-padmavat-1793855 |archivedate=30 December 2017}} [[Anna M. M. Vetticad]] of ''[[Firstpost]]'' criticised the film's glorification of ''jauhar'', but credited Padukone for managing to "eke something out of the stereotype-ridden writing".{{cite web |last=Vetticad |first=Anna MM |title=Padmaavat movie review: Bhansali couches regressive, opportunistic messaging in exhausting visual splendour |url=http://www.firstpost.com/entertainment/padmaavat-padmavati-padmavat-movie-review-bhansali-couches-regressive-opportunistic-messaging-in-exhausting-visual-splendour-4317153.html |website=[[Firstpost]] |date=24 January 2018 |accessdate=24 January 2018 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180124090649/http://www.firstpost.com/entertainment/padmaavat-padmavati-padmavat-movie-review-bhansali-couches-regressive-opportunistic-messaging-in-exhausting-visual-splendour-4317153.html |archivedate=24 January 2018}} Ankur Pathak of ''[[HuffPost]]'' too took note of the film's regressive theme but thought that Padukone had played her part with "restrained elegance".{{cite news |last=Pathak |first=Ankur |url=http://www.huffingtonpost.in/2018/01/23/padmaavat-review-ranveer-singhs-queer-act-shatters-the-glass-ceiling-in-indian-film-writing_a_23341645/ |title='Padmaavat' Review: Ranveer Singh's Queer Act Shatters The Glass Ceiling In Indian Film Writing |date=24 January 2018 |work=[[HuffPost]] |accessdate=24 January 2018 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180124061209/http://www.huffingtonpost.in/2018/01/23/padmaavat-review-ranveer-singhs-queer-act-shatters-the-glass-ceiling-in-indian-film-writing_a_23341645/ |archivedate=24 January 2018}} With an estimated budget of {{INRConvert|2|b}}, ''Padmaavat'' is the [[List of most expensive Indian films#Hindi|most expensive Hindi film]], and with earnings of {{INRConvert|5.45|b}}, it is Padukone's highest-grossing release and one of Indian cinema's biggest grossers.{{cite web |url=http://www.boxofficeindia.com/report-details.php?articleid=3469 |title=Padmavati Being Aimed For A February Release |publisher=Box Office India |date=8 December 2017 |accessdate=8 December 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171208231459/http://www.boxofficeindia.com/report-details.php?articleid=3469 |archivedate=8 December 2017}}{{cite web |url=https://boxofficeindia.com/report-details.php?articleid=3881 |title=Worldwide Alltime : Padmaavat 7th - Baaghi 2 22nd |accessdate=26 April 2018 |date=26 April 2018 |publisher=Box Office India}} Padukone is next set to reprise the role of Serena Unger in the fourth instalment of the [[XXX (film series)|''xXx'' film series]].{{cite news |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/news/deepika-padukone-in-vin-diesels-next-xxx-film-confirms-director/articleshow/65662735.cms |title=Deepika Padukone in Vin Diesel's next 'xXx' film, confirms director |work=The Times of India |date=4 September 2018|access-date=26 September 2018}} She has also committed to star as the [[acid throwing|acid attack]] survivor [[Laxmi Agarwal]] in a biopic by [[Meghna Gulzar]], which will mark her first production venture.{{cite news |last=Bhattacharya |first=Roshmilla |url=https://mumbaimirror.indiatimes.com/entertainment/bollywood/deepika-padukone-turns-producer-for-meghna-gulzars-next-directorial/articleshow/66077252.cms |title=Deepika Padukone turns producer for Meghna Gulzar's next directorial |work=Mumbai Mirror |date=5 October 2018|access-date=5 October 2018}} ==Personal life and off-screen work== Padukone shares a close bond with her family, and visits them regularly in her hometown of Bangalore.{{cite news |author=Muthanna, Anjali |title=Deepika makes time for family in Bangalore |date=25 May 2013 |url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2013-05-25/news-interviews/39520879_1_deepika-padukone-bangalore-girl-yjhd |work=The Times of India |accessdate=25 May 2013}} She lives by herself in [[Prabhadevi]], a neighbourhood in Mumbai, and admits to missing the presence of her family there.{{cite news |title=Deepika Padukone's South Indian home |date=7 November 2011 |url=http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1P3-2505006891.html |work=Hindustan Times |accessdate=4 September 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160410000136/https://www.highbeam.com/doc/1P3-2505006891.html |archivedate=10 April 2016 |df=}} She says, "I miss them, but luckily I have a life of my own, which keeps me from getting homesick. I wouldn’t want them to uproot their lives from Bengaluru just to be with me."{{cite news |author=Ahmed, Afsana |title=I want to be the first girl Ranbir Kapoor directs: Deepika Padukone |date=23 June 2013 |url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/bollywood/i-want-to-be-the-first-girl-ranbir-kapoor-directs-deepika-padukone/story-YHxXvKq8N4PFSgD1glVKEP.html |work=Hindustan Times |accessdate=4 September 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160203134412/http://www.hindustantimes.com/bollywood/i-want-to-be-the-first-girl-ranbir-kapoor-directs-deepika-padukone/story-YHxXvKq8N4PFSgD1glVKEP.html |archivedate=3 February 2016 |df=}} A practicing [[Hindu]], Padukone considers religion to be an important aspect of her life and makes frequent visits to [[Hindu temple|temples]] and other religious shrines.{{cite news |author=Batra, Ankur |title=Deepika Padukone on a religious trip |date=8 September 2011 |url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2011-09-08/news-interviews/30123474_1_deepika-padukone-golden-temple-morning-walkers |work=The Times of India |accessdate=25 May 2013}} While filming ''Bachna Ae Haseeno'' in 2008, Padukone began a romantic relationship with co-star Ranbir Kapoor.{{cite web |title=I've been dating Deepika for few weeks: Ranbir Kapoor |date=17 March 2008 |url=http://www.sify.com/movies/i-ve-been-dating-deepika-for-a-few-weeks-ranbir-kapoor-news-bollywood-kkftL3hfdja.html |accessdate=17 March 2008 |publisher=[[Sify]] |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101231090325/http://www.sify.com/movies/i-ve-been-dating-deepika-for-a-few-weeks-ranbir-kapoor-news-bollywood-kkftL3hfdja.html |archivedate=31 December 2010 |df=}} She spoke openly about the relationship and sported a tattoo of his initials on the nape of her neck.{{cite news |last=Behrawala |first=Krutika |title=Tattoo Tales |date=17 August 2012 |url=http://archive.indianexpress.com/news/tattoo-tales/987803/ |accessdate=4 September 2013 |work=The Indian Express |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160208095326/http://archive.indianexpress.com/news/tattoo-tales/987803 |archivedate=8 February 2016 |df=}} She has said that the relationship had a profound effect on her, transforming her into a more confident and social person. The Indian media speculated on an engagement, and reported that this had occurred in November 2008, although Padukone had stated that she had no plans to marry within the next five years.{{cite book |title=Drum |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=_OosAQAAIAAJ |year=2008 |publisher=Drum Publications (East Africa) |page=98 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131114120425/http://books.google.com/books?id=_OosAQAAIAAJ |archivedate=14 November 2013 |df=}} The couple broke up a year later;{{cite news |author=Lalwani, Vickey |title=Deepika-Ranbir call it quits! |date=3 November 2009 |url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2009-11-03/news-interviews/28091798_1_ranbir-kapoor-deepika-padukone-nihar-pandya |work=The Times of India |accessdate=10 December 2009}} she professed in an interview to feeling betrayed for a long time. In a 2010 interview, Padukone accused him of infidelity, and Kapoor later admitted to it.{{cite news |title=He cheated on me: Deepika |date=28 September 2010 |url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/entertainment/he-cheated-on-me-deepika/story-Yb1QlWYJgHy9rIyGhoaWJP.html |work=Hindustan Times |accessdate=4 September 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151117032126/http://www.hindustantimes.com/entertainment/he-cheated-on-me-deepika/story-Yb1QlWYJgHy9rIyGhoaWJP.html |archivedate=17 November 2015 |df=}}{{cite news |author=Punoose, Rukhmini |title=Deepika on a dream run |url=http://www.verveonline.com/89/people/deepika.shtml |work=Verve |accessdate=4 September 2013 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6JwBCdTkQ?url=http://www.verveonline.com/89/people/deepika.shtml |archivedate=27 September 2013 |deadurl=yes}}{{cite news |title=Yes, I cheated: Ranbir |date=30 September 2011 |url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2011-09-30/news-interviews/30229828_1_ranbir-kapoor-deepika-padukone-relationship |work=The Times of India |accessdate=4 September 2013}} They reconciled their friendship while working on ''Yeh Jawaani Hai Deewani''.{{cite news |title='Ranbir and I have become a lot closer now' – Deepika Padukone |last=Tandon |first=Raedita |date=28 June 2013 |url=http://www.filmfare.com/interviews/ranbir-and-i-have-become-a-lot-closer-now-deepika-padukone-3546.html |work=Filmfare |accessdate=4 September 2013 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6JwAucO9G?url=http://www.filmfare.com/interviews/ranbir-and-i-have-become-a-lot-closer-now-deepika-padukone-3546.html |archivedate=27 September 2013 |deadurl=yes}} Padukone subsequently became reticent to discuss her personal life, but in 2017, she fondly spoke of her relationship with her frequent co-star [[Ranveer Singh]]. In November 2018, the couple married in traditional Konkani and Sindhi ceremonies at [[Lake Como]], Italy.{{cite news |title=Deepika Padukone, Ranveer Singh are married now, wedding ceremony ends in Italy |url=https://www.hindustantimes.com/bollywood/deepika-padukone-ranveer-singh-are-married-now-wedding-ceremony-ends-in-italy/story-OrrIJnMvTwI1wSwl7JbWqM.html |work=Hindustan Times |date=14 November 2018 |accessdate=14 November 2018}} [[File:SLAMtheTour 20Sep2014 (199) (15143666038) (cropped).jpg|thumb|left|alt=A shot of Deepika Padukone dancing on stage|Padukone performing at the "SLAM! The Tour" concert in 2014]] In addition to acting, Padukone has written opinion columns and has been involved with women's health and fitness magazines. She has also supported charitable organisations, and has performed for stage shows. In 2009, she was hired by ''Hindustan Times'' to write weekly columns for their lifestyle section; through these columns she interacted with her fans and passed details of her personal and professional life.{{cite news |last=Padukone |first=Deepika |title=My nervous excitement |url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/india/my-nervous-excitement/story-cd9szDgxJirCJBRYiRSANO.html |work=Hindustan Times |date=27 July 2009 |accessdate=7 July 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151222115730/http://www.hindustantimes.com/india/my-nervous-excitement/story-cd9szDgxJirCJBRYiRSANO.html |archivedate=22 December 2015 |df=}}{{cite news |last=Padukone |first=Deepika |title=Our love stays: Deepika |url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/entertainment/our-love-stays-deepika/story-g90A33jkUB0aliIisrjLmJ.html |work=Hindustan Times |date=12 October 2009 |accessdate=7 July 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151222091753/http://www.hindustantimes.com/entertainment/our-love-stays-deepika/story-g90A33jkUB0aliIisrjLmJ.html |archivedate=22 December 2015 |df=}} That year, she participated in the [[World 10K Bangalore]] marathon, which raised {{INRConvert|13.1|m}} in support of 81 NGOs.{{cite news |title=Deepika for charity |url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2009-07-22/people/28169980_1_charity-event-bangaloreans |accessdate=24 June 2013 |newspaper=The Times of India |date=22 July 2009}}{{cite news |title=Deepika Padukone raises Rs 1.3 crore for several charities |url=http://archive.mid-day.com/entertainment/2009/jul/090709-Bollywood-Bengaluru-Deepika-Padukone-marathon-1-crore-charity.htm |accessdate=24 June 2013 |newspaper=[[Mid Day]] |date=9 July 2009}} In 2010, Padukone adopted the [[Maharashtra|Maharashtrian]] village of [[Ambegaon]] as part of NDTV's Greenathon Campaign, to provide the village with a regular supply of electricity.{{cite news |last=Joshi |first=Tushar |title=Deepika adopts a Ambegaon village |url=http://archive.mid-day.com/entertainment/2010/mar/100310-Deepika-Padukone-Ambegaon-village-Greenathon-campaign.htm |accessdate=21 April 2013 |newspaper=Mid Day |date=10 March 2010}} She visited Indian ''[[jawans]]'' (troops) in [[Jammu]], for an [[Independence Day (India)|Independence Day]] special episode of NDTV's reality show ''Jai Jawaan''.{{cite news |title=Deepika Padukone in uniform |url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/photos/entertainment/rough-n-tough-deepika-padukone-in-uniform/photo-yIFQ9OLxuFGsGEJk7bEiUI.html |work=Hindustan Times |accessdate=24 June 2013 |date=23 November 2012 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151222144133/http://www.hindustantimes.com/photos/entertainment/rough-n-tough-deepika-padukone-in-uniform/photo-yIFQ9OLxuFGsGEJk7bEiUI.html |archivedate=22 December 2015 |df=}} Padukone took part in the opening ceremony of the [[2010 Indian Premier League|third season of the Indian Premier League]] at the [[DY Patil Stadium]] in [[Navi Mumbai]].{{cite web |title=IPL 3 kicks off with grand opening ceremony |url=http://sports.ndtv.com/cricket/news/134698-ipl-3-kicks-off-with-grand-opening-ceremony |publisher=NDTV |accessdate=24 June 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141006100537/http://sports.ndtv.com/cricket/news/134698-ipl-3-kicks-off-with-grand-opening-ceremony |archivedate=6 October 2014 |df=}} Three years later, she performed alongside Shah Rukh Khan, [[Katrina Kaif]], and [[Pitbull (rapper)|Pitbull]] for the [[2013 Indian Premier League|sixth edition]] of the Indian Premier League.{{cite web |title=IPL 2013: Shah Rukh Khan, Katrina Kaif, Deepika Padukone, Pitbull showcase diverse culture |url=http://movies.ndtv.com/bollywood/ipl-2013-shah-rukh-khan-katrina-kaif-deepika-padukone-pitbull-showcase-diverse-culture-349474 |publisher=NDTV |accessdate=24 June 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140713121133/http://movies.ndtv.com/bollywood/ipl-2013-shah-rukh-khan-katrina-kaif-deepika-padukone-pitbull-showcase-diverse-culture-349474 |archivedate=13 July 2014 |df=}} In 2014, she participated in a concert tour across North America, entitled "SLAM! The Tour", in which she performed alongside her co-stars from ''Happy New Year''.{{cite news |title=Shah Rukh Khan, Deepika Padukone take America by storm |url=http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/shah-rukh-khan-deepika-padukone-slam-american-fans-houston-new-jersey/1/384742.html |work=India Today |date=24 September 2014 |accessdate=26 September 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140926201737/http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/shah-rukh-khan-deepika-padukone-slam-american-fans-houston-new-jersey/1/384742.html |archivedate=26 September 2014 |df=}} Padukone has also been involved with the [[Olympic Gold Quest]] team, established by her father and [[Geet Sethi]] to support Indian athletes at the Olympic Games, along with sports personalities such as [[Leander Paes]] and [[Viswanathan Anand]] and several other actors.{{cite book |last=Nehwal |first=Saina |title=Playing to Win |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=tBSi3rdUPO0C&pg=PT41 |date=15 December 2012 |publisher=Penguin Books Limited |isbn=978-81-8475-915-0 |page=41 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131101113850/http://books.google.com/books?id=tBSi3rdUPO0C&pg=PT41 |archivedate=1 November 2013 |df=}} In 2013, she launched her own line of clothing for women, in association with the retail chain [[PVH (company)|Van Heusen]].{{cite news |title=Deepika Padukone makes her debut as fashion designer |url=http://archive.indianexpress.com/news/deepika-padukone-makes-her-debut-as-fashion-designer/1177826/ |accessdate=4 October 2013 |newspaper=The Indian Express |date=3 October 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140213011332/http://archive.indianexpress.com/news/deepika-padukone-makes-her-debut-as-fashion-designer/1177826 |archivedate=13 February 2014 |df=}} Two years later, Padukone collaborated with the fashion portal [[Myntra]] to launch another line under her brand "All About You".{{cite news |author=Anshul |title=Myntra launches Deepika Padukone brand ‘All About You’; prices start Rs 1,500 |url=http://www.financialexpress.com/industry/companies/myntra-launches-deepika-padukone-brand-all-about-you-prices-start-rs-1500/154226/ |accessdate=11 October 2016 |work=The Financial Express |date=20 October 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161011224233/http://www.financialexpress.com/industry/companies/myntra-launches-deepika-padukone-brand-all-about-you-prices-start-rs-1500/154226/ |archivedate=11 October 2016 |df=}} Padukone has also been outspoken on issues such as feminism and has said, "New feminism isn't about being aggressive; it's about reaching the top yet being soft. It's about being you — feminine, strong and full of will power.”{{cite book |last=Sinha |first=Dheeraj |title=Consumer India: Inside the Indian Mind and Wallet |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=Uw-XCvE9G4YC&pg=PA129 |date=14 February 2011 |publisher=John Wiley & Sons |isbn=978-0-470-82632-4 |page=129}} In a 2015 interview, Padukone spoke about her personal experience of overcoming depression, and in October that year she formed a foundation to create awareness on mental health in India, named [[The Live Love Laugh Foundation]].{{cite news |author=Awaasthi, Kavita |title=Deepika Padukone on suffering from depression: It was a struggle to wake up |date=17 January 2015 |url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/tabloid/deepika-padukone-on-suffering-from-depression-it-was-a-struggle-to-wake-up/article1-1306957.aspx |work=Hindustan Times |accessdate=18 January 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150118035439/http://www.hindustantimes.com/tabloid/deepika-padukone-on-suffering-from-depression-it-was-a-struggle-to-wake-up/article1-1306957.aspx |archivedate=18 January 2015 |df=}}{{cite news |title=Deepika Padukone launches her foundation 'Live, Love and Laugh' on World Mental Health Day |date=10 October 2015 |url=http://www.dnaindia.com/entertainment/report-deepika-padukone-launches-her-foundation-live-love-and-laugh-on-world-mental-health-day-2133489 |work=Daily News and Analysis |accessdate=28 January 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151022163008/http://www.dnaindia.com/entertainment/report-deepika-padukone-launches-her-foundation-live-love-and-laugh-on-world-mental-health-day-2133489 |archivedate=22 October 2015 |df=}} The following year, she launched a campaign named More Than Just Sad to assist general physicians in their treatment of patients suffering from depression or anxiety.{{cite news |title=Deepika Padukone’s foundation launches awareness programme on mental health |url=http://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/bollywood/deepika-padukones-foundation-launches-awareness-programme-on-mental-health-2811187/#sthash.A7hGmE4o.dpuf |date=20 May 2016 |work=The Indian Express |accessdate=22 May 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160521215431/http://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/bollywood/deepika-padukones-foundation-launches-awareness-programme-on-mental-health-2811187/ |archivedate=21 May 2016 |df=}} Also in 2016, the foundation teamed with Facebook and the [[AASRA]] organisation to launch multilingual tools and educational resources in Facebook's networking site to support people with suicidal tendencies.{{cite news |last=Alawadhi |first=Neha |title=Facebook partners with Deepika Padukone's Foundation; launches suicide prevention tools in India |url=http://economictimes.indiatimes.com/articleshow/52749651.cms |date=14 June 2016 |work=The Economic Times |accessdate=15 June 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160911230551/http://economictimes.indiatimes.com/articleshow/52749651.cms |archivedate=11 September 2016 |df=}} Padukone became the brand ambassador for the NGO [[Indian Psychiatric Society]] and on her foundation's first anniversary, the two organisations collaborated to launch the video and poster campaign #DobaraPoocho dedicated to victims and survivors of depression.{{cite news |title=Deepika Padukone named Indian Psychiatric Society's brand ambassador |url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/news/Deepika-Padukone-named-Indian-Psychiatric-Societys-brand-ambassador/articleshow/53856784.cms |accessdate=5 November 2016 |work=The Times of India |date=25 August 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160829212121/http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/news/Deepika-Padukone-named-Indian-Psychiatric-Societys-brand-ambassador/articleshow/53856784.cms |archivedate=29 August 2016 |df=}}{{cite news |title=Stigma key reason why mental health issues not being addressed: Deepika |url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/bollywood/stigma-key-reason-why-mental-health-issues-not-being-addressed-deepika/story-IhbNNQwyGfdPqwTFNsQEvM.html |accessdate=5 November 2016 |work=Hindustan Times |date=10 October 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161106061008/http://www.hindustantimes.com/bollywood/stigma-key-reason-why-mental-health-issues-not-being-addressed-deepika/story-IhbNNQwyGfdPqwTFNsQEvM.html |archivedate=6 November 2016 |df=}} ==In the media== The journalist [[Vir Sanghvi]], in 2013, described Padukone as "strong, someone who makes up her own mind, [and] has motivation within herself."{{cite news |last=Sanghvi |first=Vir |url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/brunch/shah-rukh-khan-and-deepika-padukone-in-conversation-with-vir-sanghvi/story-IVIPeV2PyW34oFg2UpCZoJ.html |title=Shah Rukh Khan and Deepika Padukone in conversation with Vir Sanghvi |work=Hindustan Times |accessdate=17 August 2013 |date=4 September 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160201125703/http://www.hindustantimes.com/brunch/shah-rukh-khan-and-deepika-padukone-in-conversation-with-vir-sanghvi/story-IVIPeV2PyW34oFg2UpCZoJ.html |archivedate=1 February 2016 |df=}} She is particularly known in the media as a professional, disciplined performer, whose "work takes precedence over everything else." A reviewer for Rediff.com described her personality as "simple," "grounded," and "accessible," and wrote, "She takes criticism in her stride, acknowledges her limitations and strives to work hard at getting better.
